fusionlibrary.eval_functions

Functions for evaluating the performance of the models and plotting the results.

Functions

compare_methods_boxplot(performances, ...[, ...])

Creates a boxplot to compare performance metrics of different methods.

confusion_matrix_plot(model, train_reals, ...)

Plots the confusion matrix.

eval_one_rep_kfold(k_fold_performances, ...)

Evaluates and visualizes the results of one repetition in k-fold cross-validation.

eval_replications(repetition_performances, ...)

Evaluates and visualizes the results of multiple replications.

k_fold_confusion_matrix(reals_list, ...)

k_fold_reals_vs_preds(reals_list, ...)

Plots real values against predicted values for each fold in k-fold cross-validation.

plot_graph(graph_data, params)

Plots the graph structure.

reals_vs_preds(model, train_reals, ...)

Plots the real values against the predicted values for the training and validation sets.

visualise_graphspace(h, color, params, ...)

Visualizes the graph space using t-SNE.
fusionlibrary.eval_functions.compare_methods_boxplot(performances, params, plot_type, rep_n=None)[source]

Creates a boxplot to compare performance metrics of different methods.

Parameters:

  • performances (dict) – Dictionary of performance metrics for different methods.

  • params (dict) – Additional parameters.

  • plot_type (str) – Type of plot (‘kfold’ or ‘repetition’).

  • rep_n (int, optional) – Repetition number (for repetition plots), by default None.

Returns:

fig – The figure containing the boxplot.

Return type:

matplotlib.figure.Figure

fusionlibrary.eval_functions.confusion_matrix_plot(model, train_reals, train_preds, val_reals, val_preds)[source]

Plots the confusion matrix.

Parameters:

  • model (torch.nn.Module) – The model to be evaluated.

  • train_reals (torch.Tensor) – The real values for the training set.

  • train_preds (torch.Tensor) – The predicted values for the training set.

  • val_reals (torch.Tensor) – The real values for the validation set.

  • val_preds (torch.Tensor) – The predicted values for the validation set.

Returns:

fig – The figure containing the confusion matrix plot.

Return type:

matplotlib.figure.Figure

fusionlibrary.eval_functions.eval_one_rep_kfold(k_fold_performances, rep_number, params)[source]

Evaluates and visualizes the results of one repetition in k-fold cross-validation.

Parameters:

  • k_fold_performances (dict) – Dictionary of performance metrics for different methods and folds.

  • rep_number (int) – Repetition number.

  • params (dict) – Additional parameters.

fusionlibrary.eval_functions.eval_replications(repetition_performances, params)[source]

Evaluates and visualizes the results of multiple replications.

Parameters:

  • repetition_performances (dict) – Dictionary of performance metrics for different methods and replications.

  • params (dict) – Additional parameters.

fusionlibrary.eval_functions.k_fold_reals_vs_preds(reals_list, preds_list, overall_metric, method_name, metric_list, params)[source]

Plots real values against predicted values for each fold in k-fold cross-validation.

Parameters:

  • reals_list (list of torch.Tensor) – List of real values for each fold.

  • preds_list (list of torch.Tensor) – List of predicted values for each fold.

  • overall_metric (float) – Overall metric for all folds.

  • method_name (str) – Name of the method.

  • metric_list (list of float) – List of metrics for each fold.

  • params (dict) – Additional parameters.

Returns:

fig_list – List of figures containing the plots.

Return type:

list of matplotlib.figure.Figure

fusionlibrary.eval_functions.plot_graph(graph_data, params)[source]

Plots the graph structure.

Parameters:

  • graph_data (pyg.data.Data) – Graph data.

  • params (dict) – Additional parameters.

fusionlibrary.eval_functions.reals_vs_preds(model, train_reals, train_preds, val_reals, val_preds)[source]

Plots the real values against the predicted values for the training and validation sets.

Parameters:

  • model (torch.nn.Module) – The model to be evaluated.

  • train_reals (torch.Tensor) – The real values for the training set.

  • train_preds (torch.Tensor) – The predicted values for the training set.

  • val_reals (torch.Tensor) – The real values for the validation set.

  • val_preds (torch.Tensor) – The predicted values for the validation set.

Returns:

fig – The figure containing the plot.

Return type:

matplotlib.figure.Figure

fusionlibrary.eval_functions.visualise_graphspace(h, color, params, path_suffix, method_name)[source]

Visualizes the graph space using t-SNE.

Parameters:

  • h (torch.Tensor) – Graph data.

  • color (list) – List of colors.

  • params (dict) – Additional parameters.

  • path_suffix (str) – Suffix for the saved image.

  • method_name (str) – Name of the method.

Returns:

fig – The figure containing the t-SNE plot.

Return type:

matplotlib.figure.Figure
